column_description: The unique identifier for the rate plan charge.
Timestamp of when a record was last synced.
Boolean identifiying whether the record was deleted in the source.
The unique identifier of the account associated with the rate plan charge.
The unique identifier for the accounting code that represents the account receivable for this charge.
The accounting code associated with this charge.
The date when the amendment order was created or processed.
The unique identifier for the amendment associated with this rate plan charge.
The type of discount that is applied to the charge.
The day of the month when the billing cycle for the charge ends.
The type of billing cycle that the charge uses.
The unique identifier of the contact associated with the account's billing information.
The unique identifier for the snapshot of the bill-to contact information that was used when the charge was created.
The billing period for the charge.
The timing of the charge.
The exchange rate for the charge when it was booked.
The date on which the exchange rate for the charge when it was booked was determined.
The model used to calculate the charge.
The number of the charge within the subscription.
The type of charge.
The date through which the charge has been charged.
The unique identifier of the user who created the rate plan charge.
The date and time when the rate plan charge was created.
The option used to calculate the credit for the charge.
The unique identifier of the default payment method for the account.
The unique identifier for the accounting code that represents the deferred revenue for this charge.
The description of the rate plan charge.
The level of the discount applied to the charge.
The amount of the charge in the charge currency.
The amount of the charge in the home currency of the company.
The deferred tax calculated value of the rate plan charge.
The deferred tax calculated value of the rate plan charge in the home currency.
The date on which the rate plan charge is no longer in effect.
The date on which the rate plan charge goes into effect.
The condition that triggers the end date of the rate plan charge.
The exchange rate used for the rate plan charge.
The date on which the exchange rate was determined.
Home currency the customer is billed in.
A boolean value indicating whether the rate plan charge is prepaid.
A boolean value indicating whether the rate plan charge has been processed.
The monthly recurring revenue of the rate plan charge.
The monthly recurring revenue of the rate plan charge in the home currency.
The name of the rate plan charge.
The number of billing periods for the rate plan charge.
The original id of the rate plan charge.
The date on which the original order was placed.
The option selected for handling price changes for the rate plan charge.
The percentage increase applied to the rate plan charge price.
The date through which the rate plan charge has been processed.
The unique identifier of the product associated with the rate plan charge.
The unique identifier of the product rate plan charge associated with the rate plan charge.
The unique identifier of the product rate plan associated with the rate plan charge.
The quantity associated with the rate plan charge.
The unique identifier of the rate plan associated with the rate plan charge.
The unique identifier of the accounting code associated with recognized revenue for the rate plan charge.
The segment associated with the rate plan charge.
The unique identifier of the contact associated with the sold-to account.
The specific billing period associated with the rate plan charge.
The specific end date associated with the rate plan charge.
The list price base for the rate plan charge.
The id of the subscription associated with the rate plan charge.
The total contract value for the rate plan charge.
The home currency value of the Total Contract Value.
The currency in which the transaction occurs.
The date on which the trigger event occurs.
The type of trigger event that is associated with the rate plan charge.
The unit of measure for the quantity of the rate plan charge.
The maximum number of billing periods for which the charge is applicable.
The time unit that is used to calculate the maximum number of billing periods for which the charge is applicable.
The id of the user who last updated the rate plan charge.
The date and time when the rate plan charge was last updated.
The version number of the rate plan charge.
The day of the week on which the bill cycle starts.
